title: Fromâ€¦to -DAnâ€¦-A kadar
desc: When describing things that have a starting and ending point, whether it is an action that starts at a specific time and ends at a specific time or the boundary is geographic â€” From Point A and  to Point B, we use "-**DA**nâ€¦-**A** kadar" to express such scenarios.

body.raw: ## Fromâ€¦to -DAnâ€¦-A kadar --- When describing things that have a starting and ending point, whether it is an action that starts at a specific time and ends at a specific time or the boundary is geographic â€” From Point A and to Point B, we use "-**DA**nâ€¦-**A** kadar" to express such scenarios. -**DA**n â†’ From - D â†’ d or t (f,s,t,k,c,s,h,p rule) - A â†’ a or e (vowel harmony rule) -**A** â†’ To/Until - Aâ†’ a or e (vowel harmony rule) kadar â†’ it is more of magnitude measure. It could be associated with time, money, distance and more. ### Examples The scenery was amazing on the journey **from** Istanbul **to** Ankara. - Ä°stanbul'**dan** Ankara'**ya** kadar olan yolculukta manzara harikaydÄ±. I worked hard **from** breakfast **until** lunch. - KahvaltÄ±**dan** Ã¶ÄŸle yemeÄŸin**e** kadar Ã§ok Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±m. I rode my bike **from** the park **to** home. - Bisikletle park**tan** ev**e** kadar gittim. I will be on vacation **from** the weekend **until** Monday. - Haftasonun**dan** pazartesi**ye** kadar tatilde olacaÄŸÄ±m. Our shop is open **from** 10 am in the morning **until** 6 pm in the evening. - Sabah Saat 10â€™**dan** akÅŸam saat 6â€™**ya** kadar dÃ¼kkanÄ±mÄ±z aÃ§Ä±k. We walked **from** the cinema to the **market**. - Sinema**dan** market**e** kadar yÃ¼rÃ¼dÃ¼k. I am studying for the exam **from** morning **until** evening. - Sabah**tan** akÅŸam**a** kadar sÄ±nava Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±yorum. I will be in Istanbul **from** Monday **until** Friday. - Pazartesi**den** cuma**ya** kadar Ä°stanbulâ€™da olacaÄŸÄ±m. Our country continues to develop in every field, **from** health **to** technology, agriculture **to** economy. - Ãœlkemiz saÄŸlÄ±k**tan** teknoloji**ye**, tarÄ±m**dan** ekonomi**ye**, her alanda geliÅŸmeye devam ediyor. The last sentence is probably something you would hear on the news ðŸ“º. --- Thanks for reading!
